title: Risk Management Comparison
similarities: All standards require systematic risk identification processes
Risk assessment and analysis are fundamental across all frameworks
Risk response planning is emphasized in all approaches
Continuous risk monitoring throughout project lifecycle
Documentation of risks in registers or logs

descriptions.pmbok: Uses both qualitative and quantitative risk analysis with detailed probability and impact assessments
descriptions.prince2: Focuses on risk tolerance and appetite with theme-based categorization
descriptions.iso21500: Emphasizes systematic risk processes integrated with organizational governance

descriptions.pmbok: Four main strategies: Avoid, Transfer, Mitigate, Accept (plus Exploit, Share, Enhance for opportunities)
descriptions.prince2: Prevent, Reduce, Transfer, Accept with emphasis on risk tolerance levels
descriptions.iso21500: Focuses on risk treatment options aligned with organizational risk management

pmbok: Monte Carlo simulation for quantitative analysis
prince2: Risk theme integration with other themes

title: Stakeholder Management Analysis
similarities: Stakeholder identification is the first critical step
Analysis of stakeholder influence and interest levels

descriptions.pmbok: Power/Interest grid, Influence/Impact grid, Stakeholder cube model
descriptions.prince2: Organization theme with defined roles and responsibilities matrix
descriptions.iso21500: Stakeholder register with influence and impact assessment

descriptions.pmbok: Detailed stakeholder engagement plan with specific strategies per stakeholder
descriptions.prince2: Communication management strategy integrated with organization theme
descriptions.iso21500: Stakeholder engagement integrated with communication management

pmbok: Data representation techniques for stakeholder analysis
prince2: Defined project roles (Project Board, Project Manager, Team Manager)

title: Quality Management Comparison
similarities: Quality planning as foundation for quality management
Quality assurance and quality control processes

descriptions.pmbok: Prevention over inspection, customer satisfaction, management responsibility
descriptions.prince2: Fit for purpose approach with customer quality expectations
descriptions.iso21500: Quality management system integration with organizational standards

descriptions.pmbok: Seven basic quality tools, statistical sampling, inspection techniques
descriptions.prince2: Quality review technique, quality criteria definition, acceptance criteria
descriptions.iso21500: Quality assurance processes aligned with ISO quality standards

pmbok: Cost of quality (prevention, appraisal, failure costs)
Quality management plan as subsidiary plan
prince2: Quality review technique with defined roles
iso21500: Integration with ISO 9001 quality management systems
Quality policy alignment with organizational strategy
